paper_abstract: The field of peer-to-peer reputation systems has exploded in the last few years. Our goal is to organize existing ideas and work to facilitate system design. We present a taxonomy of reputation system components, their properties, and discuss how user behavior and technical constraints can conflict. In our discussion, we describe research that exemplifies compromises made to deliver a useable, implementable system. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Taxonomy of trust: Categorizing P2P reputation systems
